critique: The executive order seems to aim for a sense of reassurance and control. It addresses potential injustices in the food industry during a time of national security concerns. The order empowers the Food Administrator to regulate licensees and prevent unfair practices. The emotions the president wants to convey are: 1. Joy: The order aims to bring joy by ensuring fair practices and preventing unjust profits. 2. Fear: The order might induce fear in those who engage in unjust practices, as they will be held accountable. 3. Surprise: The order might surprise those who were unaware of the potential for regulation and control in the food industry. 4. Disgust: The order expresses disgust at unjust, unreasonable, discriminatory and unfair practices. 5. Sadness: The order expresses sadness that there are unjust, unreasonable, discriminatory and unfair practices. Based on this analysis, I will assign initial scores and then revise them based on further consideration.
